thread.title: Freiburg 1-2 Bayern Munich: Robert Lewandowski double spares Bundesliga leader's blushes
thread.title_full: Freiburg 1-2 Bayern Munich: Robert Lewandowski double spares Bundesliga leader's blushes

author: Alex Richards
title: Freiburg 1-2 Bayern Munich: Robert Lewandowski double spares Bundesliga leader's blushes
text:
Lewandowski celebrates his stunner (Photo: Reuters) Share Get football   Could   
Robert Lewandowski's stunning stoppage time winner handed Bayern Munich a hard-fought win in Freiburg. 
Die Roten ended 2016 back on top of the Bundesliga after a six-game winning streak, culminating in a 3-0 thumping of RB Leipzig ahead of the winter break. 
But Carlo Ancelotti's men were slow starters on their return to action at the Schwarzwald Stadion and were thankful to Polish hitman Lewandowski for saving them, as he bagged both goals. 
On a freezing night, a Bayern side with Thomas Muller restored to his preferred central role behind Lewandowski were left surprised by the energy of their hosts and found themselves behind after just four minutes. 
Christian Streich's side were all over their opponents and after Mats Hummels failed to deal with the icy pitch, Janik Haberer coolly slotted into the bottom corner. Haberer coolly converts (Photo: Getty) Read More Bayern Munich star Xabi Alonso set for surprise retirement 
Bayern looked somewhat startled by the energy of the hosts, but almost found an equaliser through Robben, only for him to shoot over. 
But on 35 minutes, a Douglas Costa corner wasn't dealt with well by the home side, and Lewandowski's effort could only be pushed into his own net by Freiburg keeper Alexander Schwolow. Lewandowski celebrates his equaliser (Photo: Reuters) Bayern celebrate the leveller (Photo: Getty) 
That was Lewandowski's 13th goal of the season and as the clock ticked down past 90', it looked like Bayern would have to settle for a point. 
But then, from nothing, Lewandowski pounced, with the kind of sure-footed control and finish that evoked memories of his great strike in his four-goal salvo for Borussia Dortmund against Real Madrid in 2013. 
A seemingly tame Franck Ribery cross was brilliantly controlled on the chest by the Pole, who - under pressure from two defenders - took a touch with his right foot as he landed before digging out a finish that rolled into the bottom corner with his left. Robert Lewandowski scores the winner (Photo: Getty) 
"I don't think I had total control over the ball - I just tried my best to control it and get a shot away," said Lewandowski after the game when quizzed on his winner. 
"Freiburg defended well and posed a threat on the break. But three points is three points." poll loading Who will win the Bundesliga? 500+ VOTES SO FAR
